sn15.11:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī.
sn15.11:1.4: No first point is found of sentient beings roaming and transmigrating, hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving.
sn15.11:1.5: When you see someone in a sorry state, in distress, you should conclude:
sn15.11:1.6: ‘In all this long time, we too have undergone the same thing.’
sn15.11:1.7: Why is that? Transmigration has no known beginning. …
sn15.11:1.8: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed regarding all conditions.”
